Description: Greenish blown glass jug with an outsplayed lip, a thickened rim, a neck expanding downwards to a bulbous body, a thick solid drawn-out stem, and a splayed base with a moulded rim. The ribbed handle is splayed at the rim attachment and has a top wing. Decorated with a trail on the upper side of the base.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (pl.113)
Buckton 1994 / Byzantium: Treasures of Byzantine art and culture from British collections (no.20, p.42-43)
Harden et al 1968 / Masterpieces of Glass (117)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1987 25 Apr-19 Oct, USA, Corning, Corning Museum of Glass, Glass of the Caesars 1987 18 Nov-1988 15 Mar, London, British Museum, Glass of the Caesars 1988 15 Apr-26 Jul, Germany, Cologne, Römisch-Germanisches Museum, Glass of the Caesars 1988 30 Sep-1989 6 Jan, Italy, Rome, Museo Capitolino, Glass of the Caesars
